content.title: Feed And Fodder Entrepreneurship Scheme
content.department: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
content.details: The scheme aims to establish an effective seed production chain, build capacity among state functionaries and livestock owners in forage production, and create synergy among ongoing programs for fodder resource development.
benefits: 100% subsidy on fodder seed production to identified beneficiaries
Assistance for procuring machinery like Bailers, Block making machines, TMR machines/equipment, and Forage Harvesters
eligibility: Entrepreneurs/Eligible Entities with training or experience in managing the project
Sanctioned loan for the project from a bank or financial institution
Ownership or lease of land for project establishment
content.application_process: Online application through the Udyam Mitra portal, followed by screening, loan sanctioning, subsidy approval, and disbursement.
documents_required: Proof of land holding (ownership or lease)
Income proof and bank statement for the last six months
Detailed Project Report including total cost, recurring cost, net income
Name, Aadhar no., mobile no., and address of farmers linked with the entrepreneur

faqs.question: What are the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Affordable quality fodder, increased farmer’s income, and assistance in procuring machinery.

faqs.question: Who are eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Individuals, Self-Help Groups (SHG), Joint Liability Groups (JLG), Private entrepreneurs, Farmer producer organizations, Dairy cooperative societies, Section 8 companies (NGOs).

faqs.question: How to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply through the Udyam Mitra portal.

faqs.question: What documents are required?
faqs.answer: Supporting documents including proof of address, land holding, education certificate, and detailed project report.

faqs.question: How much subsidy is provided under the feed and fodder entrepreneurship program?
faqs.answer: 50% direct capital subsidy to the beneficiaries.
